subject: RE: [junit] Re: JUnit Patch: Reducing duplication in all TestCase	s everywhere
msgSnippet: Hi, I am trying to run a script within the setUp() method. I have three test cases inside my test suite. However as expected, the script (UNIX shell script,
messageBody:
Hi,

I am trying to run a script within the setUp() method. I have three test
cases inside my test suite. However as expected, the script (UNIX shell
script, ran using uWIN) does not execute itself thrice but 6 times !!

Why is this happening ?

Also, if I want the setUp() method to be executed only once for all the test
cases within a suite then what should I do ?

Please help !!

Thanks & Regards,
Aparna.


-----Original Message-----
From: alex@... [mailto:alex@...]
Sent: 23 March 2002 20:41
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Re: JUnit Patch: Reducing duplication in all TestCases
everywhere



Also, I did a rudimentary test of the Text, Swing and AWT TestRunners
but I'm still not totally clear on all the usages of TestSuite and
whatnot, so it'd be great if someone with a nice, big, fat,
complicated set of tests would install my patch, remove all their
constructors, and give it a whirl. That'd make me more confident.

Thanks -

- Alex


On Sat, Mar 23, 2002 at 12:28:33PM -0800, guru@... wrote:
> I just made a patch for JUnit to fix the long-standing annoyance of
> having to declare
>
> public MyTestCase(String name)
> {
> super(name);
> }
>
> at the top of every single TestCase ever written. Talk about removing
> duplication!
>
> Download from http://www.purpletech.com/junit-patch/
>
> My patched JUnit will happily instantiate a TestCase with no
> constructor (that is, with the default no-arg constructor that the
> compiler sticks in there automatically), and then call its setName()
> method.
>

--
